TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ProcessModelLogLevel extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the event types to be logged to the event log.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelLogLevel> enumeration contains the values to use when you set the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection.LogLevel%2A> property.
The default value is Errors.
## Examples The following code example shows how to set the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection.LogLevel%2A> property.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection#23](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection/CS/processmodelsection.cs#23)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection#23](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection/VB/processmodelsection.vb#23)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelLogLevel All = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Specifies that all process events are logged. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this option when you want to explore the possible errors an application might issue, without any filtering. This option is useful during the building and debugging phase.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelLogLevel Errors = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Specifies that only unexpected shutdowns, memory-limit shutdowns, and deadlock shutdowns are logged. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is the default value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelLogLevel None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Specifies that no events are logged. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You might want to use this option for tested and deployed applications.
